div.head: A Letter to the Author from the worthy, WILLIAM SEGAR Esquire, GARTER, principall King of Armes.
div.p: SYR, I haue viewed your Elementary Booke of Armories, and, in my poore iudgment, doe approue the same no lesse singular for the deuice, then generall for the matter, and absolutely the best of any in that kind. Your labours deserue encouragements by how much they are written freely, and ingeniously, and may be called as well the ALIMENTS as the ELEMENTS of ARMORIES, for that they nourish the mind of the Reader with a profitable, and pleasing satiety of excellent matter. Finis coronat opus, Your good Wine needs no Garland. Yet because it was your pleasure I should deliuer you mine opinion thereof, I haue aduentured to say thus much. And with the same recommend my loue vnto you.

closer.signed: Your louing friend WILLIAM SEGAR, GARTER
